summary: G. Robert Blakey was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCA). The documents provided are payroll and certification reports from the SCA, indicating Blakey's employment. These documents list Blakey's name, position, salary, and employment dates within the SCA during 1978. Specifically, the documents cover the periods of April, August, and December of 1978. The documents do not provide details about Blakey's specific role or responsibilities within the committee, only confirming his employment and compensation.
significance: The documents indicate that G. Robert Blakey was an employee of the Select Committee on Assassinations, which investigated the JFK assassination. While the documents do not detail his specific role, his employment within the committee suggests his involvement in the investigation process.
